citation.article-title: Clostridium chromiireducens sp. nov., isolated from Cr(VI)-contaminated soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Clostridium chromiireducens sp. nov.

Clostridium chromiireducens [chro.mi.i.re.du′cens. N.L. neut. n. chromium chromium; L. part. adj. reducens (from L. v. reducere) drawing backwards, bringing back to a state or condition; N.L. part. adj. chromiireducens chromium reducing].
Cells are obligately anaerobic, spore-forming, Gram-positive rods, ~4.0–7.0×1.0–1.5 µm.
Cells are motile and exhibit peritrichous flagella.
Colonies are white, convex and translucent, with smooth edges becoming irregular after incubation for 2 days.
Glucose fermentation yields a mixed acid fermentation, with acetate, lactate, formate and butyrate accumulating in the medium.
Cr(VI) and Fe(III) are reduced during growth on glucose.

Resistant to rifampicin and capable of growth with glucose, mannitol, lactose, sucrose, maltose, salicin, xylose, arabinose, cellobiose, mannose, raffinose, trehalose, glycerol, melezitose, sorbitol, rhamnose and pectin.
Does not produce urease and does not hydrolyse gelatin or aesculin.

The major fatty acids (>5 %) are C16 : 0, C14 : 0, summed feature 3 (comprising iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c), C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 1ω9c, summed feature 4 (comprising iso-C17 : 1 I and/or anteiso-C17 : 1 B) and C18 : 1ω9c.
The type strain, GCAF-1T ( = DSM 23318T = KCTC 5935T), was isolated from a chromium-contaminated wetland soil.
16S rRNA gene sequence phylogeny places the type strain within group I of the genus Clostridium.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 30.7 mol%.
